thag2.45:1.1: One should not suspend others from the Saṅgha, nor raise objections against them;
thag2.45:1.2: and neither disparage nor raise one’s voice against one who has crossed to the further shore.
thag2.45:1.3: One should not praise oneself among the assemblies,
thag2.45:1.4: but be stable, measured in speech, and true to your vows.
thag2.45:2.1: For one who sees the meaning so very subtle and fine,
thag2.45:2.2: who is skilled in thought and humble in manner,
thag2.45:2.4: it’s not hard to gain extinguishment.
